Container.Name: PhotoStructure
Container.Overview:
PhotoStructure is your new home for all your photos and videos.
- Cross-platform libraries that you can move seamlessly across Docker, Windows, macOS, and Linux - Fast, fun mobile-friendly UI - Support for very large (250k+) libraries - Support for almost all RAW and video formats (thanks to LibRaw and FFmpeg) - Robust metadata support, including Google Takeouts, XMP sidecars, and sibling inference - Robust image and video deduplication
Be sure to visit the forum for tips, support, and to vote on what features you want to see next!
Initial template by Spants (thanks!)
Container.Description:
PhotoStructure is your new home for all your photos and videos.
- Cross-platform libraries that you can move seamlessly across Docker, Windows, macOS, and Linux - Fast, fun mobile-friendly UI - Support for very large (250k+) libraries - Support for almost all RAW and video formats (thanks to LibRaw and FFmpeg) - Robust metadata support, including Google Takeouts, XMP sidecars, and sibling inference - Robust image and video deduplication
Be sure to visit the forum for tips, support, and to vote on what features you want to see next!

Config.Name: Web UI
Config.Description: Port to access the HTTP UI. Can be modified by setting the PS_HTTP_PORT environment variable.

Config.Name: Library
Config.Description: This is where your PhotoStructure Library will be stored. It needs to have sufficient free space to hold preview images, and transcoded videos.

Config.Name: User ID
Config.Description:
This is the userid that PhotoStructure will run under, instead of the default of root (userid 0).
Files copied into your library will be owned by this userid.

Config.Name: Group ID
Config.Description: This is the groupid that PhotoStructure will run under.

Config.Name: TZ
Config.Description: Setting the default timezone helps PhotoStructure infer captured-at time for assets that are missing timezone metadata.

Config.Name: Logging level
Config.Description: Valid values are debug, info, warn, and error. Default is error, which (should be) quiet.

Config.Name: Temp/Scratch disk
Config.Description: This needs to be fast, local disk.

Config.Name: Logs
Config.Description: Logfiles will be written into this directory. Set environment variable

Config.Name: System config
Config.Description: System configuration is written into this directory.
